frame.name: Strictness
frame.definition:
<def-root>These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an <fen>Agent</fen>, usually with regard to another person (the <fen>Controllee</fen>) and often with regard to a particular <fen>Issue</fen>. The strictness/lenience with respect to the <fen>Issue</fen> may be manifested in (expressed by) an <fen>Agent</fen> or by some <fen>Medium</fen> (e.g., laws), or by some behavior of the <fen>Agent</fen>, i.e., the <fen>Controlling_act</fen>.
<ex>Court says <fex name="Agent">judge</fex> <fex name="Degree">too</fex> <t>lenient</t> <fex name="Area">in rape case</fex>.<fex name="Issue">INI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Sonny</fex> <m>was</m> <t>indulgent</t> <fex name="Controllee">of her admirers</fex> and allowed their attention for a time before she disappeared into the small back room.</ex> <ex><fex name="Medium">Some laws</fex> <m>are</m> just <fex name="Degree">too</fex> <t>strict</t>.</ex> <ex>Don't <m>be</m> <t>strict</t> <fex name="Issue">about cross-posting</fex>.<fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This FE is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name="Agent">The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name="Agent">school</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Controllee
FE.definition: <def-root>The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control. The Controllee generally occurs in a PP Complement. Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name="Controllee">with their grandchildren</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Controlling_act
FE.definition: <def-root>The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name="Controlling_act">in dealing with the offender</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition: <def-root>The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation. Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name="Issue">about pollution control</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient. Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name="Medium">rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name="Medium">Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>. </def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Area</fen> is the arena in which the <fen>Agent</fen> is or is not strict.</def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
<ex>I like to think he quaked under my <t>authoritarian</t> <fex name="exp">glare</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> embodies the strictness associated with him or her.
<ex>These could perhaps be tied to the sometimes <fex name="man">cruelly</fex> <t>authoritarian</t> structures of the peasant household.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: authoritarian.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: favouring or enforcing strict obedience to authority at the expense of personal freedom.

lexUnit.name: indulgent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: readily indulging someone or overlooking their faults; tolerant or lenient.

lexUnit.name: liberal.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: respectful and accepting of behaviour or opinions different from one's own.

lexUnit.name: strict.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: demanding that rules concerning behaviour are obeyed.

lexUnit.name: tolerant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing a willingness to allow or endure a disagreeable behavior or person.
